intro: Alexitoxicon officinale, commonly known as the joyweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and hairy, broad leaves. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils near rivers or in open woodlands. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticulturists and researchers studying medicinal plants.
